result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Leeray Defoor

records.addlTxt: 22R 014995.   Posted by C. Kubnick. olg

AMENDED

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Contact with K. Lieffring up to probation agent. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Walmart. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

8:31 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Aaron Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jason Leeray Defoor in court, in custody, Attorney Jon Elton Stanek appeared by video for Jason Leeray Defoor. Court notes bond modification filed by DE. ADA Damrau states that bond was modified in Branch III case. DE states that he is no longer on a PO hold. ADA Damrau objects to bond modification. Court modifies bond. Court sets PTC. Court orders DE to report to probation upon release. DE confirms address and updates phone number. Branch III approved to hear global resolution. Adjourned: 8:50 AM. kma

03:35 PM   Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy  ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Jon Elton Stanek   DF:  Jason Leeray Defoor appeared from jail. DF wishes to waive the Preliminary Hearing.    Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. DF waives time limits for arraignment. Bond continues.  Adjourned: 3:36  Arraignment scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
